info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 11:50PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern DuPage and northwestern Cook Counties through 1215 AM CDT... At 1149 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong and gusty showers over West Chicago, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. The DuPage ASOS reported a 45 mph wind gust with these showers. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Aurora, Naperville, Schaumburg, Palatine, Wheaton, Hoffman Estates, Elmhurst, Lombard, Bartlett, Streamwood, Carol Stream, Hanover Park, Addison, Glendale Heights, Elk Grove Village, St. Charles, Glen Ellyn, West Chicago, Rolling Meadows and Roselle. Including the following interstates... I-88 between mile markers 122 and 123. I-90 between mile markers 65 and 71. I-290 between mile markers 1 and 14. I-355 between mile markers 25 and 30. This includes... Schaumburg Boomers Baseball, College of DuPage, DuPage County Fairgrounds, Harper College, and Wheaton College. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
